item.title: R Fundamentals
item.description: It is very important in terms of computing knowledge that during your daily jorney with the R Programming you should make a notebook with the principals commands, like a computing R library. Because of that I have decided done this alphabetical list with the major commands in R. Enjoy it! Asign z <- x + y z ## [1] 7 Basic operations n + 5 ## [1] 15 Code Flow if (x < y){ print("x is lesser than y") } else if (x == y){ print("x is equal to y") } else { print("x is greater than y") } ## [1] "x is greater than y" for (i in 1:10) { print(i) } ## [1] 1 ## [1] 2 ## [1] 3 ## [1] 4 ## [1] 5 ## [1] 6 ## [1] 7 ## [1] 8 ## [1] 9 ## [1] 10 t <- matrix(1:6, nrow = 2, ncol = 3) t ## [,1] [,2] [,3] ## [1,] 1 3 5 ## [2,] 2 4 6 for (i in seq(nrow(t))) { for(j in seq(ncol(t))){ print(t[i,j]) } } ## [1] 1 ## [1] 3 ## [1] 5 ## [1] 2 ## [1] 4 ## [1] 6 Data Frames o <- c(1, 3, 5) p <- c("red", "yellow", "blue") q <- c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE) df <- data.
